<div class="tile">
<h2 class="post-title"><i class="fa fa-book fa-2x"></i> Project</h2>
<p class="post-excerpt">
The `r web_title` Health Index (BHI) is a regional study applying the Ocean Health Index framework. The aim is to initiate the development of a tool that can be used by decision-makers to guide management of the Baltic Sea region towards increased sustainability. 
</p>
</div>

<div class="tile">
<h2 class="post-title"><i class="fa fa-cubes fa-2x"></i> Our team</h2>
<p class="post-excerpt">
BHI is jointly led by Stockholm Resilience Centre (SRC) and [Baltic Eye](http://www.su.se/ostersjocentrum/english/baltic-eye) at the Baltic Sea Centre, both at Stockholm University, together with the Ocean Health Index team. The project is funded by [Baltic Ecosystem Adaptive Management](http://www.su.se/ostersjocentrum/english/beam), Baltic Eye, and the Johansson Family Foundation.
</p>
</div>

<div class="tile">
<h2 class="post-title"><i class="fa fa-globe fa-2x"></i> Ocean Health Index </h2>
<p class="post-excerpt">
The Ocean Health Index ('OHI') is a scientific framework to measure how healthy oceans are. Understanding the state of our oceans is a first step towards ensuring they can continue providing humans benefits now and in the future. Learn more at [ohi-science.org](http://ohi-science.org).
</p>
</div>
